title: Inconsistency Detection & MathematicsReasoningEngine

tasks.description: Create src/proof/inconsistency-detector.ts with InconsistencyDetector class - Implement analyze(), detectContradictions(), detectTypeMismatches(), detectDomainViolations(), detectUndefinedOperations(), detectAxiomConflicts(), detectQuantifierErrors() methods
Implement contradiction detection logic - Syntactic negation matching (P and ¬P), semantic contradiction (x>0 and x≤0), derived contradiction, type-based contradiction patterns

Create src/proof/circular-detector.ts with CircularReasoningDetector class - Implement detectCircularReasoning(), isSelfReferential(), findReasoningCycles(), detectBeggingTheQuestion(), detectTautologies() methods

Create src/modes/mathematics-reasoning.ts with MathematicsReasoningEngine class - Orchestrate ProofDecomposer, GapAnalyzer, AssumptionTracker, InconsistencyDetector, CircularReasoningDetector. Implement analyzeProof(), analyzeForThoughtType(), checkConsistency(), generateReport() methods
Integrate MathematicsReasoningEngine with MetaMonitor in src/services/MetaMonitor.ts - Track proof decomposition metrics over session, detect when proof quality drops, suggest mode switches

Create src/proof/patterns/warnings.ts - Catalog of common mathematical fallacies: division by hidden zero, assuming what's to be proved, affirming consequent, denying antecedent, hasty generalization, ambiguous middle term
Update src/proof/index.ts - Export InconsistencyDetector, CircularReasoningDetector, warning patterns, and related types

Create tests/unit/proof/inconsistency-detector.test.ts - Test direct contradiction detection (P and ¬P), division by zero detection, circular reasoning detection, hidden assumption detection, quantifier scope errors

Create tests/integration/proof/consistency.test.ts - Test full consistency analysis workflows: consistent proof passes, inconsistent proof flagged, circular reasoning detected, multiple issues in same proof
Run typecheck and full test suite - Verify no TypeScript errors and all tests pass

successCriteria: InconsistencyDetector finds contradictions with >90% accuracy on test cases
CircularReasoningDetector identifies cycles correctly with no false negatives
Integration with MetaMonitor working for proof quality tracking
40+ tests passing for consistency analysis features
notes: This sprint builds the inconsistency detection capabilities. The InconsistencyDetector should be conservative - prefer false negatives over false positives to maintain user trust. CircularReasoningDetector uses the DependencyGraphBuilder's cycle detection. MathematicsReasoningEngine is the main orchestrator that ties all components together.
